dublin_core.dcvalue: Questionnaires were sent to 14 maternity hospital staff members for qualitative assessment at the start of fetal telediagnosis and at the end of the study using a five point Likert scale 5 I strongly think so 4 I think so 3 I can t decide 2 I don t think so 1 I never think so Ten questionnaires were returned to us 71 The results showed that the staff reported a significant increase in confidence in performing fetal cardiac screening score 2 3 at start 3 4 at study completion P 0 034 the rate of score increase rose with the number of telediagnoses r 0 72 P Under 0 05 feedback from a specialist was very useful 4 4 and 4 9 respectively and real time image transmission was preferred over recorded images score 3 7 vs 2 4 respectively P 0 042 The excellent educational effect of telemedicine is useful for staff members to improve their skills while nurturing their motivation leading to the promotion of fetal cardiac screening in regional areas
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-07T13:33:01Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2014-09-25
Pediatrics international : official journal of the Japan Pediatric Society
Increased satisfaction of maternity hospital staff involved in fetal telediagnosis.
